name: Create GitHub issues from Linear backlog
description: Manually creates GitHub issues from Linear backlog items. The workflow retrieves all issues in the Linear backlog, formats them with Linear issue identifiers and descriptions, and creates corresponding GitHub issues in a specified repository. This is useful for syncing project management items to GitHub for development tracking. Execute this workflow manually by triggering the 'manual/create-github-from-linear' event.

config.note: Execute this workflow manually by sending an event: { name: 'manual/create-github-from-linear', data: { tenantId: 'default', repository: 'owner/repo' } }

steps.name: Get Repository
steps.description: Retrieves the target GitHub repository from event data or configuration

steps.name: Get Linear Backlog
steps.description: Fetches all Linear issues in the 'Backlog' state
steps.code: const issues = await tenant.linear.api.issues.list({ filter: { state: { name: { eq: 'Backlog' } } } });

steps.name: Create GitHub Issues
steps.description: Creates GitHub issues for each Linear backlog item (up to 20)
steps.code: await tenant.github.api.issues.create({ owner, repo, title: `[Linear ${identifier}] ${title}`, body: formattedDescription, labels });
